header.rec_loc: In the ticket office at the TME near Taunton.
header.topics: Cataract operation on one eye. Finding lost objects through visualization. The build up of unwanted objects in the home. Dogs moving about at night.
header.activity: Second interview with ANON at TME working party near Taunton.
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, Inquiring, requesting, anecdote telling

speaker.dialect_rep: I may have a slight Somerset accent
speaker.occupation: retired artist and antique dealer/gallery owner

body.u: can't officially drive for another twenty-six hours but I think I can see better now than I could w before I had my cataract done
so erm was saying from beginning to end it only took twenty minutes

oh it's a bit longer than that I went in at about twenty to three li they put the drops in and erm it all ran down the side of my face and went in my ear I thought and li I'll have a numb ear but it didn't
but it did numb the eye and the top of my head I went to scratch the top of my head afterwards and I thought it's gone
yeah er it was interesting let's put it that way I was quite apprehensive as first one but you don't see anything
and erm all you see is a light shining in your bad eye
and you can see movement or stuff coming towards it and going away but you can't make out any details and there's no pain or discomfort even
right right and what's your vision like today in that eye?
it er better than it's been for a long long time
so you were telling me on the way here what can you can and can't do
I can't drive as I said for another day
but I've got a son to do that anyway
er and that's about it really
nothing else just you know be sensible
and I've got to wear a a plastic lens to stop me rubbing it inadvertently overnight
and that's that's held on with
and I woke up just before I got up and I thought oh it's gone
I felt around and I couldn't find it
and when I saw the wife cos she always er gets up very early she said you lost your eye patch in the night I said yeah I know I did she said I saw something glinting on my arm and it was stuck to it
I said well what are you trying to do to me in the night?
she says no I'm more like the other way round but I have no recollection
no recollection of it at all
oh dear it's funny I I I remember years ago I had to wear a brace at night you know when I was a kid
and it was always the other side of the room in the morning and I couldn't understand how it got the other side of the room
erm but erm you know that there you go
it's not only humans that move around in the night dogs do as well
yeah because when I or a few years ago I had terrible sciatica and I couldn't lie down and I spent night after night sitting sleeping in the chair
and the two dogs were there and the number of times I woke up and they were on the move
yeah th yeah we put a a throw on the settee
and they sleep on that they've got a big bed in the kitchen they sometimes sleep on that
they're going backwards and forwards and then they they go to sleep on the on the floor they're er quite remarkable
er our dog never seemed to he always slept on his bed erm well when I saw him erm he didn't like being woken up in the night
well our older one s very often he goes to sleep on the settee in the evening
and his jowls flop open so his teeth are sticking up in the air
and then four legs in the air
and he's got teeth out of all proportion to his size
tell me I've been meaning to ask you did you find your erm brass plaques?
no well I'm sorry I failed you but I had a look

I thought about them in the night and erm and I I I what came into my head was this immediately it's always the first thing that comes into your head and it doesn't always work erm have you somewhere at home got a a container like a tank? erm it's like a sort of erm
er iiiin a building I and either an outbuilding or a garage and I I just that's what came into my head so they could
yeah there's there's one not far from the green baize
I mean the green baize is 's railway I mean I've built that railway for him when he was a child
and he's thirty-four years old now and he won't get rid of it
but that the that's a an old door plus an extension
covered in green baize with all the
the s the rest of the stuff built on it
and that is behind the computers there are two computers on a stand and I thought no it can't be behind there there's not enough room but I'm sure they're in that room somewhere but it's
er jokingly called a third bedroom
you know it it's my parents in when they were alive had an old persons' flat and they had a
so I'm sure yeah but there is a big white plastic thing on top of there
and it's full of well what I call junk and calls stuff
in fact I don't very often don't use a work as polite as that but erm
well the the I read a book one about cheese it was called who stole my cheese no Who Moved My Cheese? have you read that?
I think I have I can't recall it but there's yes I think I have
and cheese that's gets left around a long time and not used iis is really sort of ripe cheese
well it walks out doesn't it?
it walks out exactly erm and it's erm so we often say there's a lot of old cheese in the attack we m we've got to shift or there's a lot of old cheese you know
we're always saying things like that
I'm not as polite as that
no as you've heard this morning I forgot you were here sorry about that
no I didn't even hear you erm I'm I I swear myself I went to drama school years ago
and we did a lot of swearing because we had to swear on stage
so you know you you you just tended
to to carry on swearing erm so getting back to this stuff I did see the floor and I saw the green baize
but then I saw the tank
you ever get in there you might find it
I'm looking for them is that is missing your is missing a certain range I've said well I might have them if I've
oh that's so kind of you
he's desperate for them w every time we go to a junk shop round and there's a
a a box full of er of horse brasses
he did give me a list I don't promise I've got them and the chances are I haven't but ah there it is oh it isn't
do you you everyone gets the same at these rallies don't they?
I've been going to rallies long before I finished the erm the traction engines
because I don't know whether you remember a member long dead called

he used to go along to rallies with a tableful of hot air engines and I used to tag along with him and I had a couple of stationary engines that I used to run on a little fridge comprescompressor erm so they go back a long long time back to the
so it's possible I've got something he's after but I won't know till I find them
no no I see oh well let it go er
I mean I've started saying to rallies now they they put on do you want a plaque? and I always put no cos
I dunno what to do with them
no no exactly exactly erm well that's that's right I mean erm wants to mmount them all up and when we take the Austin seven out he want to
erm so erm how are we doing?
the only one plaque I've got on my well I've got two a sticker on one of my trollies that a carry coal and stuff around in so
a bad day of steaming is better than a good day at work
and on the back of it that got me it said what is it? nothing beats a good a wife and a steam engine or vice versa or something like
yeah erm can you describe what they're doing behind us? cos that'll be quite interesting
persuaded the contractors that are building the estate over in the distance
to come along and scrape some turf for us so we can create a road
and they piled it up and those lads are shifting the spoil
and taking it down to the bottom where the railway goes in a loop and the the embankment needs reinforcing
so that's exactly what they're doing
and most unfortunately in my delicate state I can't help them
that's such a shame isn't it?
oh I feel so terrible about it
I said said well can't drive the trailer that was for som that was for something else was it? and I s
no that w er that was to bring in some aggregate
and I said well you mustn't let him I said because he's just had a cataract operation
and I said you mustn't let him do that and he said no no no I I won't I won't but erm
oh I should be alright next t next week
it was funny yesterday afternoon he said to me they still haven't come back to me about the the
bulldozer did he tell you this?
and he sai I said well why don't you just go round there and say you know you were just passing and you've just
thought you'd call in so he did yesterday afternoon and they did it and which was great
I mean but it was all a bit
it was all a bit er ad hoc but
erm they're so close aren't they?
I mean they're just across the road there
that's right and of course I've one of the few people in the club that's got a vehicle that'll do a heavy tow
yes I kn yes that's right yeah that's that's
and I can tow three tons with that truck
erm your average car you're lucky to do about sort of eighteen hundred in weight to be honest
well absolutely erm I couldn't I mean I've got that small smart car I couldn't tow anything behind that that's not a car it's more of a pet
what strikes me with those is how expensive they are for what you get
yes but not if you buy them at thirteen years old and they're nearly clapped out with an
erm and I just keep topping up the oil
I I love old I love cars I love trying cars out and that car is a brilliant little car to drive
no she wouldn't I've still got an old Land Rover she wouldn't drive that
has got an old Land Rover my daughter would have a go but mine's sorned at the moment and it's off the road my
I don't know what to do with it whether to keep it another two or three years it's going to be tax exempt
which means it's going to be worth more if I sell it
but at the moment it's got no road tax and it's it's sorned and it's out of MOT as well
so it's pretty old but my
son's is nineteen seventy-four and his is tax exempt now
his is a historic vehicle class
gosh I wish I'd held on to some of my cars I've had a a collection of of really I MGs h erm er all sorts all sorts of cars
well is a he's a right petrol head
erm he went drag racing last Saturday standing quarter of a mile from zero ended up a hundred and thirty-five miles an hour
and he came second on the he there was a an Audi
beat the beat the pants off it with his Nissan
that's it it is road legal that Nissan
but erm he's got a a two A4 pages of list the of modifications he's given to the
cos he's doubled the power output
it's meant to be two hundred brake horsepower
it's now four hundred and ten
it's got modified wheels his rear tyres are about eighteen inches wide
erm bigger turbo bigger intercooler uprated cylinder head uprated valves uprated clutch which isn't uprated enough he's gonna put another one in it
cos if he's one of his best mates is erm foreman at a at a garage
and after hours they can they let him go in there and do them
right right right oh that's erm that's great goodness for hhaving a person who's actually got a garage which erm it gives you a bit of space to work doesn't it?
well they've got it's a commercial garage
erm they are they are actually the main dealers for a car
but you know they've got all the equipment
they've got the ramps they've got the lifting gear
makes it so much easier doesn't it?
when you're trying to do a project
so let's describe the day then
it's er well it's a typical grey November day
drizzling but everything's brighter with my right eye now
yeah amazing the that c that wall of that shed
with my right eye is a light cream
erm and it's a dark dark mucky yellow with my left eye
so I can see that being done eventually
aren't you gonna change the colours of the sh er er w didn't say you were gonna paint it or something?
it needs painting it all needs painting
are you going to keep the same colours?
as far as I know it's neutral isn't it?
yeah erm yes I su yes I suppose yeah the erm
and of course it's the same colours as the the what what do they call it over there? the pavilion the
it's the same colour as the
I think it was done with that in mind to merge everything in
yeah exactly to make everything look
cohesive really but then they went for these erm bright blue railings didn't they?
because they're more model engineers colour than
yeah well when delivered me this morning he said did a load of gay people design this play park?
he said look at the colours
and he wasn't quite as moderate as that
yeah there are lots of different colours but I suppose
that that's for children isn't it?
nothing gaudy just plain red and yellow
so erm there you go well we just got erm another minute and a half to do
and erm that's your water tank in the middle then er is it?
it's a big black thing that's a complete white elephant
doesn't seem to have anything any feeding er
the only reason it's still there no it hasn't is that we don't want to cause offence to the person who constructed it
it hasn't got a er there's a screw on lid in there somewhere
but we don't put it on because the kids climb up it and use it as a Frisbee
erm I think eventually it will go
because we've got mains water up coming out of the wall
there's another outlet just just at the far end of the platform there's a water tower going in there but of course this time of the year it's a limit to what you can do really
yeah yeah what were you goi? said you were going to do some concreting somewhere
it would be nice to have the steaming bays concreted but I think that's just too big a task to be hon
yeah yeah oh well there you go so erm right well that's fine we're erm we've managed to
